page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The designated area includes all of St Martins and some areas from adjoining parishes. The main activities in the area are tourism, horticulture and dairy-farming and although the area is rural, it is quite densely populated, the only relatively sparsely inhabited area being the cliffs. Dotted along the coast are several small rocky beaches which are protected from the westerlies. The cliffs rise steeply and then slope into a plateau. When viewed from above the boundaries of the fields, roads and buildings are shown to follow the pattern of the old strip system of farming. Further inland the area becomes more built up and the main shopping centre is found apoproximately 2.5 kilometres from the coast.
